Package colony

Class Ant

  • java.lang.Object
    • colony.Ant
  • public class Ant
extends java.lang.Object
    The Ant class represents ants that are created and used during a stochastic simulation execution. The ants are responsible for traversing a weighted graph in order to find the cycle with no repeated nodes with the shortest weight possible. Therefore, the implementation of Ant provided assumes that it is used in a problem using a graph represented by nodes, and the ants store the path they traverse in the graph as a list of nodes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ant

        public Ant​(int nbnode)
        Constructor for an Ant.
        Parameters:
        nbnode - number of nodes of the graph. The path is set as a linked list of Nodes. The weight of the path is initialized with infinity. All nodes are initialized as non-visited.

      • setNodePath

        public void setNodePath​(Node node)
        Method to add a node to the ant's path. This method also checks this node as visited in the ant's pathcheck field.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to add to the ant's path.

      • removeNodePath

        public boolean removeNodePath​(Node node)
        Method to remove a given node from the ant's path. This method also checks this node as non-visited in the ant's pathcheck field.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to be removed from the ant's path.
        Returns:
        true if the node is present, false otherwise.

      • getPathcheckOne

        public boolean getPathcheckOne​(int idx)
        Getter for one node in the pathcheck field.
        Parameters:
        idx - the index of the node.
        Returns:
        true if the element with that index was already visited by this ant; false, otherwise.
